text: おお、どこいった?
grammar: いった is the casual past tense of 行く (went)

text: 逃がすな!ここで仕留めておくんだ!
translation: Don't let it escape! Finish it off here!

vocabulary.meaning: to let escape, to set free
to finish off, to bring down (prey)

grammar: ~な is the casual negative imperative (don't do); ~ておく means to do something in advance/preparation; ~んだ adds emphasis/explanation

text: 이곳은
お前、誰?
拠点防衛型ロボット、P-33 / 防衛命令、実行中 / 侵入者、直ちに
translation: Base defense robot, P-33. / Defense order: executing. / Intruder: immediately...
grammar: The robot speaks in fragmented, telegraphic style typical of machines; ~中 suffix indicates 'in the middle of'

text: お前、目から、水、流れている。
grammar: The robot's fragmented speech pattern shows limited language ability; ~ている indicates continuous state

text: ラック、ママ。
私のマスターも死んだ
grammar: も (also) indicates shared experience with the crying child

text: 何百年も前に私残して
translation: Hundreds of years ago, leaving me behind.
grammar: 何百~も emphasizes 'as many as hundreds'; ~て form at end indicates incomplete sentence (trailing off)

text: 正確には / 874年10ヶ月14日前だ
translation: To be precise... / 874 years, 10 months, and 14 days ago.
grammar: 正確には means 'to be precise' or 'accurately speaking'

text: 寂しい? / そのような行動は命令されていない
translation: Lonely? / Such behavior is not commanded.
grammar: ~されていない is passive negative continuous form (is not being commanded)

text: 私は泣かない
カリル、死ぬ
grammar: Robot's simple declarative statement about future event

text: 殺す、殺される
grammar: The contrast between active 殺す and passive 殺される shows understanding of cause and effect

text: カリル、殺される、ダメ
カリル、P-33、守る
grammar: Robot's telegraphic speech expressing its resolution to protect

text: P-33、守る、仕事
カリル、守る、仕事
grammar: The robot redefines its mission from defense to protecting Kalil specifically

text: ここならいっぱい機械がありそうだね / これだけあっても使える機械はほんの一部さ
translation: Looks like there are lots of machines here. / Even with this many, only a small portion are usable.
grammar: ~そうだね expresses conjecture (looks like); これだけあっても means 'even with this many'

text: 見て見てこっちはまるで新品だ
translation: Look, look! This one's like new!
grammar: 見て見て is an excited repetition for emphasis; まるで~だ means 'it's just like~'

text: 慌てるな、足元に気をつけて

vocabulary.meaning: to panic, to rush, to be flustered
to be careful, to watch out

grammar: ~な is casual negative imperative (don't do); 足元に気をつけて is a common warning phrase

text: 大丈夫
お兄ちゃん
お兄ちゃん
嫌だ
grammar: 嫌だ expresses strong refusal or emotional rejection

text: 大きな音を立てると今みたいな事故が起こる
translation: If you make loud noises, accidents like that happen.
grammar: ~と indicates a natural/inevitable consequence (when/if A, then B)

text: 侵入者1名、事故で死亡
grammar: Robot's report-style speech; ~で indicates cause (by accident)

text: ロボット山か
grammar: か at the end indicates a rhetorical question or confirmation

text: あの兄弟に話を聞いてみよう / 何か知っておるかもしれぬしな
translation: Let's try talking to those brothers. / They might know something.
grammar: ~てみよう means 'let's try doing'; 知っておる is Weiss's archaic form of 知っている; かもしれぬ is archaic for かもしれない (might); しな adds reasoning

text: やあ、いらっしゃい
弟の方か / 久しぶりだな
translation: The younger brother? / Long time no see.

vocabulary.meaning: long time no see, after a long time

grammar: ~の方 distinguishes between two people; だな is masculine sentence ending

text: 兄さんは元気か
実は4年前に事故で
translation: Actually, four years ago, in an accident...
grammar: 実は introduces unexpected or difficult news; trailing off with で implies the rest is understood (he died)

text: そうであったか / 悪いことを聞いたな
translation: Is that so... / Sorry to hear that.
grammar: そうであったか is Weiss's archaic form of そうだったか (was that so); 悪いことを聞いた is an idiom expressing condolences (lit. 'I heard a bad thing')

text: いいんです / ちょっと聞きたいことがある
translation: It's okay. / I have something I want to ask.
grammar: いいんです is polite dismissal (it's fine); ~たいことがある means 'there is something I want to do'

text: 何ですか / このあたりで魔物の話を聞いたことはないか
translation: What is it? / Have you heard any stories about monsters around here?
grammar: ~たことはないか is a polite way to ask 'have you ever...?' (lit. 'is there no experience of having...?')

text: しかも普通のやつじゃなく / 巨大だったり強力な魔物なんだけど
translation: And not ordinary ones... / But giant or powerful monsters.
grammar: ~だったり indicates listing examples (things like...)

text: そういうのが出たとは聞いていませんね
translation: I haven't heard of anything like that appearing.
grammar: ~とは聞いていません is a polite way to say 'I haven't heard that...'

text: 僕はロボットを倒すことだけが生き甲斐ですから
translation: Destroying robots is my only reason for living.

vocabulary.meaning: reason for living, purpose in life

grammar: ~ことだけが emphasizes 'only doing X is...'; から at end gives reasoning

text: そうか
grammar: そうか is a casual acknowledgment

text: ならいい、それじゃあな / あっ、ちょっと待ってください / 何だ / 実は強力な武器を手に入れたんです / あなたなら扱えると思うんですけど / しかし見たところ壊れておるようだが / ええ、歯の部分が随分傷んでいるのだよ
translation: Then that's fine. Well then... / Wait a moment! / What? / Actually, I've obtained a powerful weapon. I think you could handle it. / But it looks broken. / Yes, the blade part is quite damaged.
grammar: 壊れておる is Weiss's archaic form of 壊れている; ようだ expresses appearance (seems like); のだよ adds explanation

text: のでそのままでは威力を発揮できないんです / 直せるのか
translation: So as it is, it can't show its true power. / Can you fix it?
grammar: 威力を発揮する means 'to demonstrate/show power'; ~できない means 'cannot do'

text: はい、素材さえあれば
translation: Yes, if I have the materials.
grammar: ~さえあれば means 'if only there is...' (さえ emphasizes the minimal condition)

text: なら素材を取ってくるよ / よかった
translation: Then I'll go get the materials. / Great!

vocabulary.meaning: to go get and bring back

grammar: なら indicates 'in that case'; ~てくる means to go do something and return

text: 捨ててしまうにはもったいなくて / 必要な素材は形状記憶合金です
translation: It would be a waste to throw away. / The material you need is shape-memory alloy.

vocabulary.reading: けいじょうきおくごうきん

grammar: ~てしまうには indicates 'for the purpose of doing completely'; もったいなくて is the te-form giving reason

text: 地下2階にいる大型の敵からしか取れないので気をつけてくださいね / あと、こちらが地下2階に行くためのパスコードです / エレベーターで使用してください
translation: You can only get it from large enemies on basement floor 2, so be careful. Also... / Here's the passcode to go to basement floor 2. Use it in the elevator.
grammar: ~からしか取れない means 'can only obtain from...'; ~ために indicates purpose

text: わかった
兄は死んでしまったか / まだ若かったであろう
translation: So his brother died... He was still young, wasn't he?
grammar: ~てしまった expresses completion with regret; であろう is Weiss's archaic form of だろう (probably, I suppose)

text: 商売のため危険な場所にまで分け入ったようだ
translation: It seems he ventured into dangerous places for business.

vocabulary.meaning: to venture into, to push through

grammar: ~にまで emphasizes 'even to the point of'; ようだ expresses conjecture based on evidence

text: 弟のために自分の楽しみを後回しにして、兄はそれで幸せだったのか
translation: He put his own enjoyment aside for his brother. Was he happy with that?
grammar: ~を後回しにする is an idiom meaning 'to put something off/aside'; のか at end makes it a reflective question

text: 弟が笑ってくれたり喜んでくれるだけで幸せなんだ
translation: Just having your little brother smile and be happy is enough.
grammar: ~てくれる indicates someone doing something for you (with gratitude); ~たり lists examples; ~だけで幸せ means 'just that is enough for happiness'

text: それが兄ちゃんってやつだ
translation: That's what being a big brother means.
grammar: ~ってやつだ is a casual expression meaning 'that's what X is' or 'that's the nature of X'

text: 人や荷物を乗せて、水上を行く乗り物
translation: A vehicle that carries people and cargo across water.
grammar: This is a definition/riddle format; ~て connects actions (carries and travels)

text: カリルのおかげ
grammar: ~のおかげ expresses gratitude for positive outcomes caused by someone

text: 私に言葉たくさん教えてくれた
grammar: ~てくれた indicates someone did something beneficial for the speaker

text: 知らない世界を教えてくれた
translation: Showed me worlds I didn't know.
grammar: 知らない世界 is a noun phrase (worlds that I don't know)

text: 見たもの同士、一緒にね

vocabulary.meaning: fellow, comrade, people sharing a trait

grammar: ~たもの同士 means 'people who have both done X'; ね adds gentle confirmation

text: 逃がすな!逃がすな!
translation: Don't let it escape! Don't let it escape!
grammar: ~な is negative imperative (don't do)

text: えっと、これはちょっと時間がかかりそうですね
translation: Um, this looks like it will take some time.
grammar: ~そうですね indicates appearance/conjecture (looks like it will...)

text: 完成したらお手紙で連絡させてもらいますよ
translation: I'll let you know by letter when it's done.
grammar: ~たら is conditional (when/if); ~させてもらう is humble form meaning 'to be allowed to do'

text: ありがとう、助かるよ

vocabulary.meaning: to be saved, to be helped

grammar: 助かる is commonly used to express gratitude (lit. 'I'm saved')

text: いらっしゃい、武器仕上がっていますよ

vocabulary.meaning: to be finished, to be completed

grammar: ~ていますよ indicates current state with informative tone

text: ああ、ありがとう
その武器なら
grammar: なら indicates conditional 'if it's that weapon' / 'speaking of that weapon'

text: なんだ / お願い
兄さんの仇を討ってください
grammar: 仇を討つ is a set phrase meaning 'to avenge'; ~てください is polite request

text: 随分物騒なことを思いついたな
translation: That's quite a violent thing you've come up with.

vocabulary.meaning: to think of, to come up with

grammar: ~な is a masculine sentence-ending particle expressing mild surprise

text: 思いつきなんかじゃない / 俺が武器を作ってきたのはこのためなんです
translation: It's not just an idea! / This is why I've been making weapons!
grammar: ~なんかじゃない strongly denies something (it's not just/merely...); ~てきた indicates continuous action up to now; ~のはこのためなんです means 'the reason for... is this'

text: あいつらを殺せる道具を作りたくてやってきたんです / 金儲けのためなんかじゃない
translation: I've been doing this to make tools that can kill them! / Not for money!
grammar: ~たくてやってきた means 'have been doing because I want to'; ~なんかじゃない emphatically denies

text: あいつら? / そうです / 魔物と一緒にいる大きなロボットです
translation: Them? / Yes! / The big robot that's with the monsters!

text: 魔物とロボットが手を組んでおるだと?
grammar: 手を組む is an idiom for cooperation/alliance; ~ておる is Weiss's archaic continuous form; だと? expresses disbelief/surprise

text: 魔物がいるのか?
はい
心は決まったか? / ああ、やってやる
translation: Have you made up your mind? / Yeah, I'll do it.
grammar: 心が決まる means 'to make up one's mind'; やってやる is emphatic form of やる (I'll do it/show them)

text: この穴の下が、例のロボットのいる部屋らしいな
translation: Below this hole seems to be the room where that robot is.
grammar: らしい indicates hearsay or inference (it seems); 例の refers to something previously mentioned

text: よし、このまま降りる / この穴からか
translation: Alright, let's go down like this. / Through this hole?
grammar: よし is an exclamation showing determination

text: 下がどうなっているかわからん
translation: We don't know what's down there.

vocabulary.meaning: what is happening, how things are

grammar: わからん is Weiss's archaic/masculine form of わからない (don't know)

text: 迂回するのも面倒だ / 行くぞ
translation: Going around is too much trouble. / Let's go!
grammar: ~のも面倒だ means 'even doing X is troublesome'; ぞ is masculine emphatic particle

text: アンケン、アンケン、排除する
grammar: Robot speech pattern; アンケン likely represents 'danger' in robotic speech

text: 魔物がいるぞ / 魔物が指示を出しておる
translation: There's a monster! / The monster is giving orders!
grammar: 指示を出す means 'to give orders'; ~ておる is Weiss's archaic continuous form

text: 足を狙って倒しましょう
translation: Let's aim for its legs and bring it down!
grammar: ~ましょう is volitional form (let's do)

text: 魔物を倒せ
grammar: 倒せ is imperative form of 倒す (defeat!)

text: 排除する、排除する、排除する
grammar: Repetition shows robot's single-minded directive

text: 防衛、私の職務
grammar: Robot's telegraphic speech defining its purpose

text: 魔物が...くそ...あれは魔物だ!魔物なんだ!
translation: The monster... Damn... That's a monster! It's a monster!
grammar: なんだ adds emphasis and emotional insistence

text: 殺せ!殺せ!憎み合え!
grammar: 殺せ and 憎み合え are imperative forms (commands)

text: 反撃
連携するのか
grammar: ~のか indicates surprised questioning

text: 上から瓦礫が落ちてくるぞ / よけろ
translation: Debris is falling from above! / Dodge!
grammar: ~てくる indicates movement toward speaker; よけろ is imperative (dodge!)

text: ナッシュンズ / ナッシュンズ / ナッシュンズ
ナッシュンズ
外
世界 / 見たい
grammar: ~たい expresses desire

text: 魔法
戦う
逃がった!
grammar: 逃がった appears to be a dialectal/casual past form

text: 機械を全部... / 黙って戦え、クソ神!気が散る!
translation: All these machines... / Shut up and fight, damn grimoire! You're distracting me!
grammar: 黙って is te-form used as manner (silently); 戦え is imperative; 気が散る is an idiom for being unable to concentrate

text: お疲れ様でした
一緒
カリル
寂しい
ピーサン / 寂しい
カリル...
お前...
こんな機械に、兄さんは、母さんは
translation: Because of machines like this, my brother... my mother...
grammar: Trailing off with は indicates unfinished emotional statement

text: お前さえいなければ、お前さえ、お前さえいなければ、お前さえ
translation: If only you weren't here... if only you... if only you weren't here...
grammar: ~さえいなければ is a strong counterfactual conditional meaning 'if only X didn't exist'; the repetition shows emotional breakdown

text: いいね、人間らしい、実に人間らしい
grammar: ~らしい attached to nouns means 'befitting, typical of'; the Shade is sardonically praising human hatred

text: その辺でもういいだろう
grammar: その辺で indicates stopping at a certain point; だろう softens the statement

text: 俺はやりましたよ / こいつがいなくなれば山に入りやすくなる
translation: I did it! / With this thing gone, it'll be easier to enter the mountain.
grammar: ~やすくなる means 'to become easier to do'; ~ば is conditional (if)

text: これからはいくらでも強い武器を作れますよ
translation: From now on, I can make as many powerful weapons as I want!

vocabulary.meaning: as much as one wants, unlimited

grammar: いくらでも emphasizes unlimited quantity

text: 任せてください

vocabulary.meaning: to entrust, to leave to someone

grammar: ~てください is polite request/offer form

text: わかった / わかったから
grammar: から at the end implies 'so (stop talking about it)'

text: 憎悪と凶器では心は癒すことはできぬ
translation: Hatred and weapons cannot heal the heart.
grammar: ~では marks negative condition (with X, one cannot...); できぬ is Weiss's archaic form of できない (cannot)

text: でもそうするしかないんだ
translation: But I have no other choice.
grammar: ~するしかない is an idiom meaning 'have no choice but to do'

text: 愚かな / そうだな
grammar: 愚かな is na-adjective; Weiss uses archaic/literary tone

text: どうして機械と一緒にいたのでしょうか
translation: Why was it with the machines?
grammar: ~のでしょうか is polite wondering/questioning form

text: 機械に指示を出し / 協力しておるようだった
translation: It was giving orders to the machines. / It seemed to be cooperating with them.
grammar: ~ておる is Weiss's archaic continuous; ようだった means 'it seemed that'

text: 何か考えがあったんでしょうか
translation: Did it have some kind of plan?
grammar: ~んでしょうか is polite speculative question (I wonder if...)

text: あの魔物には / あの魔物は
grammar: The speaker trails off, unable to complete the thought

text: 魔物が何を考えていようと / 殺した方がいいに決まっている
translation: No matter what a monster is thinking... / It's obviously better to kill them.
grammar: ~ていようと means 'no matter what X is doing'; ~方がいいに決まっている means 'it's obviously better to'

text: そうだな / 魔物が機械なんかを守ろうとするなんて / 馬鹿げた話だ
translation: Yeah... / A monster trying to protect machines? / What a ridiculous story.
grammar: ~ようとする means 'to try to do'; なんて expresses disbelief or disdain

text: お前たちも気をつけろよ
grammar: 気をつけろ is imperative form; よ adds emphasis/warning

text: 私も魔物に支配されると / 仲間でさえ襲ってしまうからな
translation: When I'm controlled by the monster... / I even attack my allies.
grammar: ~に支配される is passive (to be controlled by); でさえ means 'even'; ~てしまう indicates regrettable action

text: 違う / カイネはカイネだ / 魔物じゃない
translation: That's wrong. / Kaine is Kaine. / Not a monster.

vocabulary.meaning: to be different, to be wrong

grammar: XはXだ is an emphatic construction affirming identity

text: こやつの言う通りだ / 下着女と魔物は違う
translation: This one speaks the truth. / The underwear woman and monsters are different.
grammar: こやつ is Weiss's archaic form of こいつ; 言う通りだ means 'what X says is true'; 下着女 is Weiss's insulting nickname for Kaine

text: 魔物は下品な言葉は使わないからな / ぶっ飛ばすぞ、クソ神! / もし魔物に支配されても僕が止めます / そうか、ありがとう / ここは例の夢の村だな / そうだな / できれば
translation: Monsters don't use vulgar language. / I'll knock you flying, damn grimoire! / If you're controlled by the monster, I'll stop you. / I see... Thanks. / This is that dream village. / Yeah. / If possible...

vocabulary.meaning: to knock flying, to send flying

grammar: からな gives reasoning with masculine emphasis; もし~ても is conditional 'even if'; 例の refers to previously mentioned topic
